Legal_Issue: Whether the Board erred in concluding state protection was available in Portugal and whether it breached fair hearing rules
Application_Facts: Applicant could obtain Portuguese citizenship through formalities; threats from a criminal organization were claimed as grounds for refugee status
Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of the Board's decision
Court_Ruling: Board's decision was correct; no breach of fair hearing occurred
Legal_Standard: A person with an automatic right to another country's nationality is not entitled to refugee protection
Assessment_Factor: Availability of state protection in Portugal
Procedural_Issue: Fair hearing requirements, including notification of key issues
Credibility_Assessment: Applicant’s testimony confirmed eligibility for Portuguese citizenship
Application_Basis: Claim of refugee protection due to fear of persecution by a criminal organization
Evidence_Assessed: Evidence regarding eligibility for Portuguese citizenship
Relief_Sought: Overturning of the Board's decision denying refugee protection
Governing_Rule: A person entitled to another country’s nationality cannot claim refugee protection
Cause_Description: Applicants denied refugee status due to eligibility for Portuguese citizenship despite claims of threats from a criminal group
Evidence_Handling: Board relied on RIR and applicant testimony; issue was known to applicant
Evidence_Assessment: Board properly assessed evidence on nationality entitlement
Decision_Rationale: State protection available via Portuguese citizenship; fair hearing upheld
Legal_Standard_Applied: Entitlement to nationality negates refugee claim
